com.espertech.esper.jmx.mbean

Interface RuntimeMBean


  • public interface RuntimeMBean
    Interface for runtime functions over an Esper engine instance.

    For input event count, use #getSendCount.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object[] fireAndForgetQueryType1(java.lang.String epl, int maxRows)
      Executes a fire-and-forget query returning Object data.
      javax.management.openmbean.TabularData fireAndForgetQueryType2(java.lang.String epl, int maxRows)
      Executes a fire-and-forget query returning JMX tabular data.
      long getElapsedSecondsSinceLastReset()
      Returns the number of seconds since the last reset.
      long getEngineTimeMillis()
      Gets the current engine time.
      long getEvaluatedAvgPerSecond()
      Returns the average number of events evaluated per second since the last reset or since start.
      long getEvaluatedCount()
      Returns the number of events evaluated, which is a total of the number of events sent into the engine via any of the send and route methods and all events generated via insert-into.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getEventCountStats()
      Returns a Map of the number of events evaluated and routed internally and externally.
      java.lang.String getEventTypeDescriptorXML(java.lang.String alias)
      Returns event type information for an event type alias as an XML document.
      java.lang.String getEventTypesXML()
      Returns descriptive information about each event type as an XML document.
      java.lang.Long getFurthestTimeHandle()
      Returns the milliseconds time slot for callback scheduled most distant in the future.
      int getListenerCount()
      Returns the number of listeners, counting per-statement and double-counting listeners attached to multiple statements.
      java.lang.String getNamedWindowDescriptorXML()
      Returns descriptive information about each named window as an XML document.
      java.lang.Long getNamedWindowEventCount(java.lang.String windowName)
      Returns the current count of events held by a named window.
      java.lang.String[] getNamedWindowNames()
      Returns names of all active named windows.
      long getRoutedExternalAvgPerSecond()
      Returns the average number of events routed externally per second since the last reset or since start.
      long getRoutedExternalCount()
      Returns the number of events routed externally, which is all events an application feed an engine via any of the route methods.
      long getRoutedInternalAvgPerSecond()
      Returns the average number of events routed internally per second since the last reset or since start.
      long getRoutedInternalCount()
      Returns the number of events routed internally, which is all events that are generated by insert-into statements.
      int getScheduleHandleCount()
      Returns the current number of schedule handles that the scheduling system of an engine instance currently holds.
      long getSendCount()
      Returns the number of events send into the engine via any of the send methods.
      long getStartTimeMillis()
      Returns the time the runtime mbean was activated.
      int getStatementCount()
      Returns the number of statements currently in started or stopped state.
      int getTimeHandleCount()
      Returns the number of entries into the scheduling table.
      long getTimerDriftAverage()
      Returns the average milliseconds timer drift.
      long getTimerLastDrift()
      Returns the last timer drift in milliseconds.
      long getTimerMaxDrift()
      Returns the max milliseconds timer drift.
      long getUptime()
      Returns the time the number of milliseconds since the runtime mbean was activated.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Class> getVariableTypesAll()
      Returns the variable names and types.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getVariableValuesAll()
      Returns all variable names and their current value.
      void resetStats()
      Reset all statistics.

      Sets a variable value.

      • getScheduleHandleCount

        int getScheduleHandleCount()
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the current number of schedule handles that the scheduling system of an engine instance currently holds.

        The number is a rough indicator of depth of objects requiring time-based callbacks.

        Returns:
        schedule handle count
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when an io error occurs and remote access

      • getTimeHandleCount

        int getTimeHandleCount()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the number of entries into the scheduling table.

        The number is a rough indicator of depth of time slots requiring time-based callbacks.

        Returns:
        time handle count
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when an io error occurs and remote access

      • getSendCount

        long getSendCount()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the number of events send into the engine via any of the send methods.

        This number is computed by the number of events evaluated minus the number of events routed internally or externally.

        Returns:
        number of events send
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when an io error occurs and remote access

      • getEvaluatedCount

        long getEvaluatedCount()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the number of events evaluated, which is a total of the number of events sent into the engine via any of the send and route methods and all events generated via insert-into.
        Returns:
        number of events evaluated
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when an io error occurs and remote access

      • getEventCountStats

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getEventCountStats()
                                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a Map of the number of events evaluated and routed internally and externally. Returns the keys evaluatedCount, routedInternalCount and routedExternalCount.
        Returns:
        map of event-count runtime stats
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when an io error occurs and remote access

      • fireAndForgetQueryType1

        java.lang.Object[] fireAndForgetQueryType1(java.lang.String epl,
                                         int maxRows)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Executes a fire-and-forget query returning Object data.

        A fire-and-forget query is a EPL query against one or more named windows that is non-continuos and leaves no trace within the engine.

        Parameters:
        epl - is the query EPL
        maxRows - the maximum number of rows to return, with 0 returning no rows, and -1 returning unlimited rows.
        Returns:
        an Object array in which the first dimension is a String[][] of property name and type, and the second dimension is an Object[][] of rows and columns
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the query failed to execute
        java.io.IOException - when an io error occurs and remote access

      • fireAndForgetQueryType2

        javax.management.openmbean.TabularData fireAndForgetQueryType2(java.lang.String epl,
                                                             int maxRows)
                                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Executes a fire-and-forget query returning JMX tabular data.

        A fire-and-forget query is a EPL query against one or more named windows that is non-continuos and leaves no trace within the engine.

        Parameters:
        epl - is the query EPL
        maxRows - the maximum number of rows to return, with 0 returning no rows, and -1 returning unlimited rows.
        Returns:
        tabular data for display in a console
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the query failed to execute
        java.io.IOException - when an io error occurs and remote access

                    java.lang.String value)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Sets a variable value.
        Parameters:
        variable - name to set the value for
        value - is the new value to set, or null if setting the value to null
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the variable could not be found, or the parsing of the value failed
